I've always been of the opinion that Ruqqus should not use any 'stuff' that cloud providers give because of vendor-lock in. Everything should be deployed on totally generic VMs so one can move up to a different host with minimum effort and downtime.
If you need database - run your own. Containers? Run your own. Lambda-like service? Run your own. Message queue, central authentication, key-value store, you name it - run your own.
